TopicTitle: Space Plane - How to Turn Off Jet Engines

Articles.Content:
I have a space plane design where I have two jet engines and two rocket engines. I get to high altitude on jets alone, then fire the rocket stage to try to get to orbit.

However I always seem to get the situation where air starvation causes one of the jets to cut out and start the plane spinning. The only thing I have found to do is right click on the engines and block the air intakes before I get too high however this is cumbersome and I want a method to turn off both engines at once.

Is there a shortcut to turn off my jets or is there a more effective way than right clicking on the components?
Yes. Create an action group that shuts off (or toggles) both engines at the same time. If you don't know how to do that, feel free to ask for more details.

Remember to set an action group to toggle the intakes at the same time as the jets. Here's how I usually do my SSTO actions:

1 - Activate jets, deactivate rocket(s).

2 - Toggle primary rockets

3 - Toggle jets, Toggle Intakes

4 - Toggle solar panels

5 - Toggle secondary rockets (if fitted)

You can set up action groups by clicking the blue tool thingy at the top of the VAB/SPH.
Thanks, didn't realise how to use action groups but have worked it out now.
Another way is to have a single jet engine and two rockets. That way, if the jet flames out, then there will be no spin.
